Lore: "General Solo, is your strike team assembled?"
Gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on Han or Back Door; draw top card of Used Pile. Non-Jedi, non-[Permanent Weapon] Rebels are defense value +2 and immune to attrition < 3. May place this Effect out of play to cancel the targeting of a weapon at same or related site.
Information: Article at DeckTech, September 19th, 2005\par Top 5 Battle-Aiding V-Cards (Light Side) by Armaedes and Shewski\par \par Wow, oh wowie. I really enjoyed V8 for all the new possibilities that it brought to LS battling, and this is one of them. It is a new twist on the "Fab Four" Effects that can fit into a variety of decks. The deployment choices are nice, but it is stronger going on the Back Door. Immediately you get some extra card advantage. Universally your EPPs and other scrub Rebels get stronger, and your opponents have some trouble deploying to your stronghold (especially nice if deployed on Han). The best thing about this text is the ungrabbable Blaster Deflection. Lots of bad things can happen to your hit characters, so don't let it happen. General Solo can pull this every turn for optimal abuse. You can even cancel your own targeting if you want to cycle this for more cards on the following turn.\par \par ARMAEDES' TAKE:\par Aargh! I can't believe I forgot this one! Although I think of this less as a battling card and more of a defensive card. In a battling deck these days, you rarely want your characters to stay on the table for long because they'll run the risk of a return beating. Really this card is about keeping your guys alive, not beating down your opponent's guys. Still a solid card, but not what I would consider a "typical" battle aid.
IsPulled: General Solo (V9)\par Rycar Ryjerd (V2)\par The Signal\par The Signal (V8)\par We Wish To Board At Once\par Your Insight Serves You Well\par Your Insight Serves You Well & Staging Areas
Cancels: Targeting of a weapon at same or related site.

Lore: Whiphid \b spy\b0  in league with Lady Valarian. Yearns for battle. Enjoys hearing the screams of his victims. Plotting to kill Jabba.
Gametext: May deploy to a shielded site, and, for remainder of that turn, suspends 'Hoth Energy Shield Rules' at his site. Once per game, when deployed to a site, opponent loses 1 Force for each Light Side character present.
Information: Article at DeckTech, September 19th, 2005\par Top 5 Battle-Aiding V-Cards (Dark Side) by Armaedes and Shewski\par \par 2. J'Quille (V)\par J'Quille (V) is a great battle-aiding card because you can get characters to any non-Dagobah location in the game with him. Unless your opponent is playing Dagobah locations (where they can't do any damage anyway), they can't put a character anywhere and be safe. If all J'Quille (V) did was get you to any location you wanted to go to, it would still be an incredible card. But he also gives you some more pro-battling gametext with the Force loss clause of his gametext. This helps battling decks because it makes your opponent more wary of stacking a whole lot of characters at one location and preventing you from battling without getting wiped out. Essentially, J'Quille (V) makes your opponent spread their Force more thinly to avoid massive Force loss, and spreading thin plays right into the hands of a solid battling deck.\par \par SHEWSKI'S TAKE:\par \par I'm torn on him. Sure, it's nice to have him as a staging area into fortified area, but I think he (and Tanus for the LS) did some bad things as well. A pullable beatdown spy for Scum isn't so hot. I also wish that the Force loss was contingent on initiating a battle at his location instead of just deployment. Some hit and run tactics can evolve from that. Finally, while at the time Speeders raised its ugly head, he was a big fat blunt object that really kicked that deck to the curb. He could probably have done enough damage on his own or if gave DS a way to drop the Hoth Shield - kinda like what a saboteur might do. I see him used more for the damage text than anything else, so he didn't make my list.
IsPulled: Murttoc Yine\par Sy Snootles

Lore: Jabba Desilijic Tiure. Male heir to Zorba the Hutt. \b Gangster\b0. \b Leader\b0  of one of the largest criminal organizations in the galaxy. Over six hundred years old.
Gametext: While with your alien leader, Jabba is immune to attrition and may not be targeted by Interrupts or weapons. May deploy one Scum And Villainy from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. During battle, may use 1 Force to double the power of one other non-[Maintenance] alien present.
Information: Jabba personas are:\par \par Jabba\par Jabba Desilijic Tiure\par Jabba The Hutt\par Jabba The Hutt (V8)\par Mighty Jabba\par -----\par Consider Hutt Bounty (V8).\par -----\par The other 'alien leader' may be Ephant Mon, who is pulled by Power Of The Hutt.\par -----\par Gains the characteristic 'Black Sun agent' by game text of Prince Xizor (V7).\par -----\par Article at DeckTech, September 19th, 2005\par Top 5 Battle-Aiding V-Cards (Dark Side) by Armaedes and Shewski\par \par If the power of Scum could be placed at the feet of one character, it would be this one, which is ironic since Jabba doesn't even really have feet. Jabba The Hutt (V) is very deck-specific, which is why he's not higher on my list, but in an alien deck he can end games on the 2nd or 3rd turn. I have personally had Jabba The Hutt (V) cause more than 50 overflow in games, and I know other players who have got that number even higher. With the number of ways dark side has to pull aliens from the deck, and with Jabba (V) doubling the power of almost all of them, you can create devastating beatdowns in record time. The best part is that the Audience Chamber deploys him from Reserve Deck and then Elis Helrot takes him wherever the fighting is. Truly a brutal battling card.\par \par SHEWSKI'S TAKE:\par Well, I might take exception on the power of Scum being focused on him, but you are right that he is a potent card. I mean, winning a battle by 20 and winning it by 40 both hurt your opponent, but both are likely game winners. I didn't rank him on my list since I don't really like what he brings to the world of SWCCG. I think there were plenty of other cool Jabbas that Scum decks could run, plus I have trouble envisioning Jabba being a flying beatdown machine.
Pulls: Scum And Villainy
IsPulled: Jabba's Sail Barge (V8)\par Wooof (V8)

Information: Article at DeckTech, November 1st, 2005\par Top 5 Damage-Controlling V-Cards (Dark Side) by Armaedes and Shewski\par \par Okay, probably nobody saw this guy coming on the list, but Grond (V) is actually quite good at blocking drains, especially if you put him on a vehicle that can move as a 'react.' Lore: Considering the life debt he owed to Han and his personal commitment to the Rebel Alliance, Chewie quickly volunteered to fly the stolen shuttle to Endor.
Gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on Chewie or Back Door; may place up to two cards from hand on Force Pile. Your battle destiny draws are +1. Once per game, may place this Effect out of play to cancel a battle just initiated here.
Information: You *have to* place one card from hand on your Force Pile, and you *may* put two cards there if you like to.\par -----\par Article at DeckTech, September 19th, 2005\par Top 5 Battle-Aiding V-Cards (Light Side) by Armaedes and Shewski\par \par I guess you can figure out that I'm a big fan of the new Endor Effects. This one is nice but in my mind not as strong as IWWTF. First off, it�s a little more limited on its deployment since Chewie is generally not as useful as Han. Secondly, it doesn't have the loop potential that IWWTF has. But it is still hard to deny the effectiveness of the Effect. Extra activation is always nice, but it is a mandatory activation- be sure to factor that into any tracking plans of yours. The universal battle destiny bonus is very helpful as is the battle canceling text. Use that if you get into a pinch and then cut into the odds with a well timed Sorry About the Mess. The most exciting bit of text on this card is the relocation part at the end. You can use it defensively to get out of the way of a beat. You can use it offensively to jump into a battle. You can also use it to get to an empty site, which ostensibly helps RST but also can get you an extra Force drain. The possibilities are endless!\par \par ARMAEDES' TAKE:\par I find it hard to consider a card that has "cancel a battle" in its gametext to be a good battle-aiding card, but the rest of the text is undeniably battle-oriented. Adding 1 to battle destiny draws is huge, and at worst will offset Lando Calrissian (V) trying to reduce your battle destiny. The "Path Of Least Resistance" text is also great for warping one of your big guns into a battle, especially in an Endor deck where you're playing a number of related locations. The deployment restrictions of this card keep it from making my own list, but in the right deck this can really cause your opponent some unexpected pain.
IsPulled: Chewbacca (V)\par I Wonder Who They Found\par General Solo (V)\par Rycar Ryjerd (V)\par The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once\par Your Insight Serves You Well\par Your Insight Serves You Well & Staging Areas

Rules: (AR 1.7.1, D-2)\par Characters, vehicles, and starships can be heroic (whether by their own game text or have it provided). Whenever a heroic card is targeted by a weapon, add 1 to the total weapon destiny. Also, in a battle where there's a heroic card, non-heroic cards cannot be targeted by weapons unless all heroic cards are hit, not participating in battle, or cannot be targeted by that weapon. \par For example, if light has a heroic character (Chewie) in a battle, then any dark side weapons that can target him can only be fired at him, but if they don't (such as targeting only a vehicle, or a non-Rebel character, or a Jedi, etc.) they wouldn't have to, if he was excluded from battle they wouldn't have to, if he left the table they wouldn't have to, if he was inside an enclosed vehicle (where he can't be targeted) they wouldn't have to, or if he was finally hit they wouldn't have to. Light would be able to target whomever they wanted because you can't target your own cards with weapons.
IsCanceledBy: Heroic and immunity to attrition canceled by Coordinated Attack (V).
